Linux Deploy : Ubuntu On Android

Posted on January 20, 2018 by Kartik B. under Uncategorized

Linux Deploy is an application is open source software for quick and easy installation of the operating system (OS) GNU/Linux on your Android device.The application creates a disk image on a flash card, mounts it and installs an OS distribution. Applications of the new system are run in a chroot environment and working together with the Android platform. In this guide we will be installing ubuntu on android via Linux Deploy

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

  • A ROOTED android phone
  • BusyBox Installed
  • A ssh client like Juice SSH, you can download it from here
  • Linux Deploy – download the app from here

 

STEP 1 —CONFIGURING THE LINUX DEPLOY

 

Once downloaded, open the app, you will see something like shown below.

 

 

At the bottom of the screen you will see three icons, click on settings icon (the right most one).

 

 

Select the Distribution you want to install and the architecture your phone supports.

My device is arm64 so I will be going with the arm64 one.

 

 

Change the username and password as per your needs.

 

 

Enable SSH under Linux Deploy settings and then go back to the home screen of the app.

 

STEP 2 — INSTALLING THE OS

 

 

On the top right , click the three dot menu and press the Install button

 

 

Next it will ask you to to confirm installation of the distribution. Tap OK . It will take a while for downloading and installation of files

 

 

when you are done, click on the start button on bottom left.

 

 

It will ask for confirmation to start it. Press OK

 

 

 

STEP 3 — CONFIGURING JUICE SSH

 

Once done, open Juice SSH.

 

 

Click on Connections.

 

 

Click on the ‘+‘ icon at the bottom right.

 

 

Add a Nickname (anything you want). Select type as SSH. Under Address use 127.0.0.1. Under Identity tap on New

 

 

Select the name you want this identity to be known with (I named it as ubuntu). Set the username and password as in Linux Deploy settings.

When you are done , click on the Tick icon on the top right.

 

 

Select the identity that you just created and tap on the top right icon to finish.

 

 

You can now see the new connection we just created under connections.Tap on it.

 

 

It will start connecting and once done it will show the screen as shown below.

 

 

This is your fully installed Ubuntu’s terminal.

If you want to view it as a GUI, enable GUI in Linux deploy settings and use any VNC viewer app to connect to it.

Congratulations, you have reached to the end of this guide. Hope you had fun installing with us. Subscribe here for more such guides.
